A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Imagine A New Hope as a standalone film. That's 'all' there is to Star Wars. 
Impossible to do now\, but that's how it was for 3 years when it came out.

Now imagine watching Empire for the first time. It changes everything. 
Probably in ways most people didn't expect. I'm sure many were not happy 
about it at the time. As a 9yo child I remember being annoyed (after Jedi) 
that Vader was even a human being.

This kind of change is what The Last Jedi has just done to Star Wars! 

Some hate the changes so much they just come out and just slate it as a 
bad movie\, picking at anything and everything. Ignoring the plan fact it is 
arguably the best 'Directed' film in the series. 

It went in a direction that was unexpected\, and unwanted for many\, though 
most would not be able to provide a better alternative that isn't just another 
retread of a past film. Comparisons to past films being something that 
new Star Wars will always have to endure. I'm not even sure how I feel 
about many of the directions this film took (on first viewing)\, but in time I 
think this will come to be seen as one of the best Star Wars films there is.
